titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Harry Gannes Manuscript From the Cradle to the Factory TAM.296
titlestmt.author: Tamiment staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 15:51:20 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Harry Gannes Manuscript From the Cradle to the Factory
did.abstract: Harry Gannes (1901-1941), at one time served (during the Popular Front era, circa 1935 - 1939) as the foreign editor of the Daily Worker, the newspaper of the Communist Party, USA. The collection consists of "From the Cradle to the Factory," an unpublished typescript (circa 1930s), 43 pp., about child labor in the United States.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Sam Darcy in 1985. The accession number associated with this gift is 1985.014.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into one folder.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Harry Gannes (1901-1941), at one time served (during the Popular Front era, circa 1935 - 1939) as the foreign editor of the Daily Worker, the newspaper of the Communist Party, USA.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Harry Gannes Manuscript From the Cradle to the Factory; TAM 296; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of "From the Cradle to the Factory," an unpublished typescript (circa 1930s), 43 pp., about child labor in the United States.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by Harry Gannes was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
